Source code for havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.attest_test

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals

from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.autoval import AutovalUtils
import re

pattern = {
    "status": "GOOD (1)",
    "host_id": "",
    "host_state": "ENROLLED (3)",
    "attest_type": "STANDARD (1)",
    "whitelist_state": "MATCHED (1)",
    "policy_name": "default-prod"}


[docs]class Attest_test:


[docs]    def __init__(self, hostname):
        self.hostname = hostname



[docs]    def run_attest_cli(self, host):
        cmd = "attestcli attest %s" % self.hostname
        output = host.localhost.run(cmd)
        AutovalUtils.validate_condition(output, "output", log_on_pass=False)

        # Parse results
        att_dict = {}
        for line in output.splitlines():
            if "=" in line and "'" in line:
                temp = line.split("'")
                name = temp[0]
                value = temp[1]
                # Get clear ssh-rsa value
                value = value.replace("ssh-rsa ", "")
                # Save results
                for key in pattern:
                    if key in name:
                        att_dict[key] = value

        # Compare results
        AutovalUtils.validate_equal(len(att_dict), len(pattern), "get all results")
        for key in pattern:
            if pattern[key]:
                AutovalUtils.validate_equal(att_dict[key], pattern[key],
                    "%s: %s" % (key, att_dict[key]))
            else:
                AutovalUtils.validate_condition(att_dict[key],
                    "%s: %s" % (key, att_dict[key]))
        return att_dict
